body: This is as-intended. Please see #2138
Perhaps we can add an option to the router to inherit params (opt-in).
That'd satisfy me, as well as the scenario referenced in #2138.  :+1:
Probably `express.Router({ params: 'inherit' })`
@adamterlson that's the idea.
@dougwilson You're my hero.

FYI, this is going to change a bit. It's basically impossible to look "up" the stack, because of the extreme flexibility here (and the fact that you can have a single router mounted in multiple places). Instead, the `params` option can simply take an object of defined params, which you can pass in. Something like `new Router({ params: app.params })`, perhaps. This is still in flux, because it does not have an easy solution with the current structure.

Just wanted to give an update here.
:+1: for this! Hopefully this gets implemented ASAP.

> Maybe these need to be tracked by separate issues?

@adamterlson I'm not sure what you're talking about, sorry. If you like, you can send an email to my email in my GitHub profile and we can have a voice conversation so I can figure out what you are talking about.

>  Does that impact param middleware working (# 2 below) or the presence of req.params from the "parent" route (# 1)?

num 1 already works and is not changing. # 2 is what this is about, but your example does populate # 2, because it doesn't use child params, so I'm still confused about what you are talking about, since your example currently works in the existing express (and thus would not be changing).

The router does not know what it's parent is, so there is no easy way to get the params from the "parent". Think of this case:

``` js
var app = express()
var app2 = express()
var router = express.Router()

app.param('user', function () { /* get user from redis */ })
app2.param('user', function () { /* get user from mysql */ })

app.use('/something', router)
app2.use('/api', router)
```

Router has, in effect, 2 parents with different params, etc. The solution to how router determines what "user" param function to use is not easy, since it cannot be determined at construction time and there is no current mechanism to bring this data to the router, especially such that it works with multiple levels of routers.

Actually, I think I may see my disconnect. I believe # 2 works in your example, but it is # 1 that does not, is that correct? # 1 should definitely be made to work for your example where the param is listed in the path on the app; that is an easy fix, actually.

Right, you nailed it there. So this ticket (and it's complicated-ness) is about # 4. There is no easy way to solve that, which is why it still has not been done.

As an aside, # 1 I didn't even realize was like that and does need to be fixed, but it's an easy fix.

This is getting a bit hairy isn't it.  So many params and routes and routers and everything!  Thank you for your time.  Your fix would totally be great for # 4.

Would you like me to create a separate issue for # 1?
I totally thought this was about #1, but anyways, it is good to hear that there's an easy fix

> Would you like me to create a separate issue for # 1?

Done here: https://github.com/visionmedia/express/issues/2203
Actually I already had created one that mentioned this too: #2153  :)
Yea, this whole thing seems to be a big disconnect between your thoughts is all :) Merging params with an option seems desirable to me, even across routers if people opt into it in their router.

i have an issue when i have 2 level of nesting Routers. the URL param processing is in the first Router level and when i give this Router the second router as code here:

router.use(require("./Router1Test"));

it ignore first level Router and just do the child Router.
meaning, when i have multi level Routers the child get priority on the parent 'router.param' calls and just ignore them.
Anyone reaching this page after 2014, all you need to do is express.Router({mergeParams: true});
I love all of you...  express.Router({mergeParams: true}) did the trick!
How does one install Express 4.5? I need this `mergeParams` feature :(

Yeah, i need it too.... im using multiple api point where i want to reuse all params like ":contentId", ":userID", ":albumId" or what eva, but also have automatic routing adding on top of app.... really need this :(
